entry.et: Middle English, from Middle French possesser to have possession of, take possession of, from Latin possessus, past participle of possidēre, from potis able, having the power + sedēre to sit potent, sit

def.dt: :to have as an attribute, knowledge, or skill
:to seize and take control of :take into one's possession
:to enter into and control firmly :dominate was possessed by demons
:to bring or cause to fall under the influence, domination, or control of some emotional or intellectual response or reaction melancholy possesses her
:to make the owner or holder used in passive construction to indicate simple possession possessed of riches possessed of knowledge and experience
